channel.title: Putting ip into client and server help
channel.description:
Well it seems like i finally got the portforwarding thing right. I know i am suppose to put an ip into the client and maybe the source. I am using the dragon history source im pretty sure its a PI just modified alot.
I do not know what files to put the ip in and i do not know exactly what ip to use. do i put my no-ip thing? Ex: (rspsname).no-ip.biz
Or do i actually put my external ip in?
Someone please help me with this =D

item.title: Putting ip into client and server help
item.dc:creator: @dropthebeat dropthebeat
item.description:

[quote=“djs15, post:1, topic:431663”]Well it seems like i finally got the portforwarding thing right. I know i am suppose to put an ip into the client and maybe the source. I am using the dragon history source im pretty sure its a PI just modified alot.

I do not know what files to put the ip in and i do not know exactly what ip to use. do i put my no-ip thing? Ex: (rspsname).no-ip.biz

Or do i actually put my external ip in?

Someone please help me with this =D[/quote]

no ip dot biz one this fucked me in the ass for the last 2 days, now i just gata get my compiler working, do you know any that work with x86? :3
